channel.title: Looking For Help or Instrouctions to help with Decrypting the iOS root files
channel.description:
[ul][li][font=trebuchet ms]Hello Everyone! my Friend has an little unusual Problem with an Ipad2 IOS 7, now the problem is kind of a brainkiller hehe, anyone know hot to jailbrake it with accualy making it haha, so to the issue... after Reinstalling the whole IOS7 system, it keep sending me to the same Location as always, wich is i need a password to loggin, " i cloud activation Code is needed " so my question is how can i avoid this kind of issue, or how do i remove it? or maybe get access someother way perhaps?.[/font][/li] [li]Thank you for your time, hope somebody have the experience and can help me out.[/li] [li]Hoping to hear from someone shortly if it's possible.[/li][/ul] Many Thank's
[font=impact][size=7]Zx2[/size][/font][font=impact][size=7].[/size][/font]
As you can see this Picture here, it's something like this that shows after i reinstalld the whole program. :/

item.title: Looking For Help or Instrouctions to help with Decrypting the iOS root files
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

not sure when this feature was introduced, but have you trid the shift+restore firmware option? usually used for bricked devices.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking For Help or Instrouctions to help with Decrypting the iOS root files

item.title: Looking For Help or Instrouctions to help with Decrypting the iOS root files
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

Even if you do jailbreak the iPod, how do you plan on using that to bypass this screen? I’m pretty sure it’ll still popup either all way. If it is truly your iPad/your friends, then just login, and if you forgot your credentials, recover the account back or call Apple as they can reset the password.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking For Help or Instrouctions to help with Decrypting the iOS root files
